questions.text: Which component of the Gram-negative bacterial cell wall is primarily responsible for the endotoxin activity?
During which phase of the bacterial growth curve is there maximal expression of virulence factors and susceptibility to antibiotics targeting cell wall synthesis?
Which method is most appropriate for culturing anaerobic bacteria from a wound specimen?
In bacterial conjugation, which genetic element is primarily transferred?
A bacterial exotoxin that ADP-ribosylates elongation factor-2 (EF-2) leading to inhibition of protein synthesis is produced by:
Which microscope is best suited for viewing live, unstained organisms such as Treponema pallidum?
The basic structure of peptidoglycan is made of repeating units of:
The organism that shows tumbling motility and grows in cold enrichment is:
The indicator used to confirm sterilization in autoclaves is:
questions.correct_answer: C. Biological indicator using Geobacillus stearothermophilus

questions.text: What is the temperature and pressure used in a standard autoclave?
Which of the following best describes passive immunity?

options.label: A
options.text: Immunity acquired after recovery from infection

options.label: C
options.text: Immunity acquired by transfer of preformed antibodies

questions.correct_answer: C. Immunity acquired by transfer of preformed antibodies

questions.text: Which type of hypersensitivity reaction is mediated by IgE antibodies?
A positive tuberculin skin test is an example of which hypersensitivity reaction?
Which type of immune response is primarily responsible for fighting intracellular pathogens like viruses?
The complement component that forms the membrane attack complex (MAC) is:
Which laboratory test is based on precipitation reactions?
Which of the following best describes the prozone phenomenon in agglutination reactions?

options.label: A
options.text: Maximum agglutination seen due to excess antigen

options.label: B
options.text: No agglutination due to excess antibody

options.label: C
options.text: Agglutination seen only with enzyme treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Agglutination seen only at high temperature

questions.correct_answer: B. No agglutination due to excess antibody

questions.text: Which type of ELISA involves the use of an antigen-coated well and detection via enzyme-labeled secondary antibody?
Which immunoglobulin is first produced during a primary immune response?
Which cell type is a professional antigen-presenting cell (APC)?

A 45-year-old diabetic patient presents with a carbuncle on the neck. Microscopy shown in the image. Coagulase test positive. Which toxin is most likely responsible for leukocyte destruction in this case?
A 5-year-old presents with pharyngitis and a sandpaper-like rash. Which toxin is implicated in the rash?
A patient develops meningitis and sepsis after eating contaminated cheese. Gram stain reveals tumbling motility bacilli. Which medium is best for isolation?
Which of the following Clostridium species is most likely isolated from canned food–related neuroparalysis?
A man presents with vomiting and diarrhea after reheated fried rice. Which is the most likely organism?
Mycobacterium leprae cannot be cultured on artificial media. Which method is used for its growth?
A 30-year-old man with HIV presents with painful violaceous skin lesions and fever. Skin biopsy reveals silver-staining bacilli. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old man presents with atypical pneumonia. Gram stain is unremarkable, and organism requires cholesterol to grow in vitro. Which of the following is most accurate?
A 60-year-old diabetic presents with black discoloration and ulceration of the external ear canal. Pus culture reveals Gram-negative, oxidase-positive rods. What is the condition called?
A young adult has urethritis with mucopurulent discharge. NAAT detects Chlamydia trachomatis. What is the best explanation for lack of bacteria on Gram stain?
A microbiology report identifies a curved, motile, oxidase-positive Gram-negative organism that grows at 42°C. What selective medium is used to isolate this organism?
A neonate born to an untreated mother develops a mucopurulent eye discharge on day 2 of life. Gram smear shown in the image. Which is the most appropriate management?
A 34-year-old traveller presents with vomiting and rice-water diarrhea. The organism is oxidase-positive and grows best in alkaline media. What is the mechanism of action of its toxin?
questions.correct_answer: B. Activates adenylate cyclase via Gs

questions.text: A sexually active 22-year-old woman has urethritis and cervicitis. Wet mount and Gram stain are unremarkable. NAAT detects Mycoplasma genitalium. What is its major virulence mechanism?
A man returns from a safari in Africa with fever and hepatosplenomegaly. Peripheral smear shows morulae inside monocytes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient has chronic gastritis with biopsy showing curved bacteria adhered to gastric epithelium. What test best detects the presence of this pathogen?
A 45-year-old male develops pneumonia after a stay in a hot tub. Culture grows oxidase-positive Gram-negative rods as shown in the image. What is the most likely organism?
A farmer develops fever, myalgia, and conjunctival suffusion after wading in floodwater. Urine culture is negative. What is the most likely pathogen?
A patient presents with a painless chancre and positive VDRL test. Which test will provide the most specific confirmation of the diagnosis?

A 27-year-old man with high-risk sexual behavior presents with a painful genital ulcer and tender inguinal lymphadenopathy. Microscopy reveals school-of-fish pattern on Gram stain. What is the most likely pathogen?
A 32-year-old HIV-positive male presents with sepsis. Blood cultures grow Haemophilus influenzae. What factor is essential for its in vitro growth?
A microbiology report identifies oxidase-positive, comma-shaped Gram-negative rods from stool samples that grow at alkaline pH. What is the selective medium used?
A 30-year-old hiker presents with relapsing fever after visiting a rodent-infested area. Spirochetes are visible on Giemsa-stained blood smears. Which organism is most likely responsible?
A child presents with a 10-day history of cough that becomes paroxysmal and associated with post-tussive vomiting. Which diagnostic test is most specific in early disease?

A 22-year-old college student presents with sudden-onset fever, headache, photophobia, and neck stiffness. Petechial rash is noted on examination. CSF shows increased neutrophils and Gram-negative diplococci. What is the major virulence factor responsible for disease severity?
A child presents with a self-limited febrile illness and regional lymphadenopathy after being scratched by a kitten. What is the most likely pathogen?
A 19-year-old college student presents with dry cough, low-grade fever, and patchy infiltrates on chest X-ray. Cold agglutinin test is positive. What is the most likely causative agent?
Diphtheria toxin is best identified using which test?
A 6-month-old infant presents with hypotonia and poor feeding. Honey consumption is suspected. Which test confirms the diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Detection of botulinum toxin in stool

questions.correct_answer: B. Detection of botulinum toxin in stool

questions.text: A patient with a long-standing IUD presents with pelvic abscess with sulfur granules. Which treatment is preferred?

A 30-year-old male presents with persistent oral thrush and chronic diarrhea. His CD4+ T-cell count is 180 cells/mm³. Which HIV gene product is directly responsible for integration of viral DNA into the host genome?
Which test is preferred to monitor the efficacy of ART in an HIV-infected patient?
A neonate presents with microcephaly, periventricular calcifications, and chorioretinitis. The mother had a mild febrile illness during pregnancy. The most likely cause is:
A 32-year-old healthcare worker develops jaundice 2 months after a needle-stick injury. Serology reveals HBsAg+, HBeAg+, anti-HBc IgM+. What is the most likely stage of infection?
A 25-year-old woman develops acute hepatitis during her third trimester of pregnancy and rapidly progresses to fulminant hepatic failure. Which hepatitis virus is most likely?
A child presents with flaccid paralysis of one leg. Stool culture reveals a virus that is positive-sense, single-stranded RNA, and resistant to acidic pH. Which virus is most likely?
Which enterovirus is associated with herpangina and hand-foot-mouth disease?
A 10-year-old child with conjunctivitis, pharyngitis, and fever is suspected to have adenoviral infection. Which of the following is a key feature of adenovirus?

A 70-year-old man presents with sudden onset fever, myalgia, and dry cough. RT-PCR of a nasopharyngeal swab confirms Influenza A infection. Which of the following features of the virus is primarily responsible for yearly outbreaks?
Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding HPV types 16 and 18?

options.label: B
options.text: They are high-risk types associated with cervical carcinoma

options.label: C
options.text: They are prevented by the bivalent vaccine only

questions.correct_answer: B. They are high-risk types associated with cervical carcinoma

questions.text: A 25-year-old fruit farmer in Kerala presents with fever, altered mental status, and seizures. Multiple cases of encephalitis are reported in the village. What is the most likely source of infection?
SARS-CoV-2 enters host cells primarily via which receptor?
What defines a cytopathic effect (CPE) in viral infections?

options.label: C
options.text: Virus-induced cell damage visible under microscope

questions.correct_answer: C. Virus-induced cell damage visible under microscope

questions.text: Viral reassortment is most likely in viruses with:
What is the first step in all viral replication cycles?
Which virus shows syncytia formation in cell culture?
Which DNA virus replicates in the cytoplasm?
What type of genome is characteristic of Rotavirus?
Which arbovirus is associated with Guillain-Barré syndrome and microcephaly?
Which virus is most associated with congenital cataracts?

A 35-year-old man presents with bloody diarrhea and right upper quadrant pain. Ultrasound reveals a liver abscess. Aspiration yields anchovy sauce–like pus. What is the most likely causative organism?
A child with a history of drinking well water presents with foul-smelling, greasy stools and abdominal cramps. Stool microscopy shown in the image. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 7-year-old presents with perianal itching, especially at night. A cellophane tape test shows eggs with a flattened side. Which treatment is most appropriate?
A pregnant woman is diagnosed with Toxoplasma gondii infection. Which fetal abnormality is most likely if infection occurred in the first trimester?

A 6-year-old child returns from sub-Saharan Africa with fever every 48 hours, anemia, and splenomegaly. Blood smear shows enlarged RBCS with ring forms and schizonts. Which species is likely responsible?
A man who recently travelled to his village presents with seizures. CT of the brain shows multiple ring-enhancing lesions with scolex visible. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A farmer presents with hematuria. Ultrasound shows bladder wall thickening. Urine microscopy shown in the image. Which is the most likely causative agent?
A malnourished child presents with chronic diarrhea. Acid-fast staining of the stool reveals small, round 4-6 micrometer sized oocysts. What is the most likely cause?
A child presents with a prolapsed rectum and dysentery. Stool microscopy reveals barrel-shaped eggs with bipolar plugs. Which parasite is responsible?
A man develops intermittent fever and hepatosplenomegaly after a trip to Bihar. Bone marrow aspiration shows amastigotes within macrophages. What is the diagnosis?
A 5-year-old child presents with malnutrition and abdominal distension. Stool microscopy shows large, bile-stained eggs with a rough, mammillated surface. What is the most likely cause?

A boy presents with subcutaneous swelling on the face that migrates over several days. He recently returned from Central Africa. Microfilariae were seen in daytime peripheral blood smear as shown in the image. What is the most likely cause?
A 30-year-old man presents with fever, malaise, and hepatosplenomegaly. Bone marrow aspirate reveals amastigotes in macrophages. Which vector transmits this infection?
A 25-year-old man develops progressive weakness, eosinophilia, and periorbital edema after eating undercooked pork. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A man from a rural village develops abdominal pain and vitamin B12 deficiency. Stool shows operculated eggs. He recalls eating raw freshwater fish. Which parasite is the cause?
A 50-year-old man has liver pain and jaundice. CT shows a large cyst with internal septations and daughter cysts. What is the definitive host for this parasite?
A child develops rectal prolapse and chronic diarrhea. Stool exam shows eggs with bipolar plugs. What is a known complication of this parasite?
A 30-year-old man presents with sudden onset of fever and altered sensorium. Blood smear shows parasites with multiple rings per RBC and banana-shaped gametocytes. What is the diagnosis?
A 7-year-old develops fever and CNS symptoms after swimming in warm lake water. CSF shows motile flagellated organisms. What is the route of entry?
A man from Africa presents with severe daytime sleepiness and confusion. Enlarged lymph nodes are noted. What stage of the parasite is found in blood?
A woman presents with hyperpigmented macules over the trunk that do not tan on sun exposure. KOH mount shows in the image. What is the causative agent?
A middle-aged gardener presents with a nodular lesion on the hand progressing to involve lymphatic channels. Biopsy shows cigar-shaped yeast cells. Which is the most probable diagnosis?
A farmer presents with a chronic foot lesion with multiple draining sinuses and black granules. Microscopy reveals septate hyphae. What is the diagnosis?
Which systemic fungal infection most closely mimics tuberculosis on chest X-ray and symptoms?
A 60-year-old diabetic patient on broad-spectrum antibiotics presents with dysphagia and white plaques in the esophagus. KOH prep reveals budding yeast with pseudohyphae. The most probable cause is:
A 29-year-old HIV-positive male presents with fever and headache. CSF analysis reveals high opening pressure. India ink staining shown in the image. The diagnosis is:
Which of the following best identifies Aspergillus species under microscopy?
questions.correct_answer: B. Narrow, septate hyphae branching at 45°

questions.text: A 58-year-old diabetic with ketoacidosis presents with facial swelling and black necrotic nasal tissue. Biopsy shows broad, aseptate hyphae with right-angle branching. Identify the organism:

A 35-year-old HIV-positive man with CD4 count of 80 presents with non-productive cough and dyspnea. CXR shows bilateral ground-glass opacities. BAL reveals organisms staining with methenamine silver, shaped like crushed ping pong balls. Diagnosis?
Galactomannan antigen detection is especially useful in diagnosing:
